title: Boyzone reveal crazy story about fan who fell off back of moving car
text:
Boyzone fans would literally risk life and limb to get close to them (Picture: Getty)

Boyzone might have appeared squeaky clean, but the band have revealed some of the craziest things that happened at the height of their fame – including fans risking their lives to be close to them.

The Irish boyband, made up of Ronan Keating, Keith Duffy, Shane Lynch, Mikey Graham and the late Stephen Gateley, attracted their fair share of overzealous fans, but none more so than a girl who ended up falling off the back of their moving car.

Keith, 45, told The Sun: ‘We came out of a stage door in Amsterdam and got into one of those American Chrysler-style people carriers that have the spare wheel connected to the back door.

‘We were ushered through screaming kids and into the van. But as we drove down the road, the scream wasn’t fading.

‘One of the fans had jumped on to the spare wheel on the back of the van and the scream kept on going and going and going.’

He said the band realised the fan was clinging on the back of their moving car – but their driver soon put a stop to that…

He added: ‘It was only after a while we realised, “Hang on, that scream’s not going anywhere” . . . until the van driver took a sharp right turn and the scream disappeared.

The band are currently finishing their final ever tour (Picture: Rex Features)

‘We never found out what happened to her. That was pretty f**king crazy.’

Erm, someone should probably have checked whether the fan was ok… here’s hoping she lived to tell the tale after being flung off the back of a speeding vehicle.

The band added that despite their clean-cut image, they think they were more rock and roll than most rock stars.

Keith explained: ‘The perception of rock stars is that they’re all about sex, drugs and rock ’n’ roll, and a boyband is all pretty boys, who are squeaky clean.

The band insist they weren’t as squeaky clean as people think (Picture: Getty Images)

‘That was completely f**king wrong. We were more honest. If you look at a rock band, they’ve got long hair that’s permed — how are they cooler than us?

‘We had shaved heads and were in the bar until six o’clock in the morning.’

Boyzone are currently performing five shows at the London Palladium this week as an end to their 26-year career as a band, which will come to a close on Friday, 25 October.

As well as the tour to celebrate their 25th anniversary, the band also released their final record Thank You & Goodnight last year.

While fans are no doubt going to miss them, at least it will mean no more of their followers will risk life and limb by flying off the back of cars while trying to get close to them.
